content.rendered:
***March 2021 Update***

Before the Spring 21 Release, you couldn’t deploy your Login Flows. You could deploy the flow itself you use for a Login Flow but the Login Flow that assigns the flow to a Profile, but Login Flow Deployment wasn’t an option.

Now Deployable!

As of this Spring 21 Release, you can now deploy your Login Flows themselves!! What a huge win! I know this was a question that’s been asked on the Community, #OhanaSlack, and my post on Login Flows at the very minimum. No need to question anymore! You can now complete Login Flow Deployment without manual steps!

Login Flow Deployment Process

How do you deploy login flows? You can use Metadata API to add or edit login flows. To delete login flows, use the Login Flow page.

Resources

How to use Login Flows

excerpt.rendered: Update for Login Flow Deployments with Spring 21 and their new availability in the metadata API making them deployable!

meta.jetpack_publicize_message: Login Flows: Now Deployable with Spring 21! Read all about it in this sazzy little update!

jetpack-related-posts.title: Login Flows – Added Authentication & More!
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Login flows, you use a regular flow with them, then you assign them to a profile, that's the Login flow part, but why use them? What is the point of them? What do you gain?  Learn about them now!

jetpack-related-posts.title: List Custom Settings
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: What is a Custom Setting?  We talked about Hierarchy Custom Settings in the Keep Clean Validation Rules with Custom Settings post, which let you set a default field value for the organization, then you can assign a value to a Profile or User.  List Custom Settings are a bit different, they don't…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Community Sharing Part 2: Guest Page Visibility
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: This post we expore guest user visibily in Experience Cloud. Every Community has a Guest User and Guest User Profile. A guest is someone that can see your community before they login - an Unauthenticated user. Each time a community or portal is created, Salesforce auto-creates a guest user profile…

img.alt_text: Community Sharing part 2_ Guest Page Visibility

jetpack-related-posts.title: Talkin’ Bout Stages in Flow
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: All about the Stage Variable within flows and how to use it so that you can have that fancy shmacy path at the top of your screens - and guess what, it's a single little lightning component that gets to be re-used and for the flow side, everything is declarative!

jetpack-related-posts.title: Process Builder How-To: Splitting Revenue
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Great info here, I have been struggling with the switch from flow triggers to process builder, and was so happy this came out when it did. Process builder, although designed to look easy, I have found working with it a pain, especially the additional clicks and delayed interface. The only…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Join Us For Automation Hour, a New Webinar Series!
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: If you are a Salesforce Admin, Developer, Analyst, Architect, or anyone else that does automation of anything in Salesforce, the new Salesforce Automation Hour is for you!
